item.title: Caravan, 7th January
item.description:
Caravan is often parked on Guan Road in the residential area on the road. It causes difficulty seeing further down the road and a crash has also occurred here recently too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 67 Guan Road, Brockworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DANGEROUS disintegrating patch reapir over manhole, 7th January
item.description:
A40 Lansdown Road, between junction with Shelburne Road and pedestrian crossing (to east of railway bridge). Inbound (eastbound) lane - manhole chamber has been covered in tarmac (chamber cover is loose / noisy), but tarmac patch has broken up within a couple of days resulting in large amount of debris in carriageway. Traffic is slowing / swerving to avoid if possible, but larger vehicles cannot miss it, thus breaking up tarmac further. DANGEROUS - NEEDS ATTENDING TO IMMEDIATELY. A proper repair is needed, not another dodge which disintegrates again within a couple of days.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 88 Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A number of potholes on the roundabout, 7th January
item.description:
Various potholes and damage to the road surface, creating trip hazards for people crossing this busy junction and also to cyclists navigating the island.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 66 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge and greenery needs cutting back behind bus stop on Tennyson Road opposite shops, 7th January
item.description:
As an able-bodied person I’ve never really thought about this but it’s a very narrow gap and should be widened from ability scooters wheelchairs and pushchairs

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 66a Tennyson Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds and even a tree growing on road and path, 5th January
item.description:
The section of road and path as you enter Cheltenham on the A4019 seems to be full of tall growing weeds. These are all along the edges of the road and in the centre where the footpath and railing are. Do they ever run a road sweeper to suck up and collect the edge of the road. There's even a tree growing out of the tarmac by the traffic lights which must be further damaging the path and will eventually obscure the lights. It seems like an awful first impression as you drive into Cheltenham.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Tewkesbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous pothole, 5th January
item.description:
There are always potholes around this location but one has become particularly deep and large, and is likely to cause damage to vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Withington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several sharp edged potholes in road, 5th January
item.description:
The location is Cleeve Common Road on a sharp right hand bend approx 200 yards from the crossroads at the first farm track gate (left Hand Side). The potholes are virtually unavoidable to hit. Please can they be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Sevenhampton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Looks like burst water pipe, 5th January
item.description:
Water pouring down the LHSof the hill. Definite starting point halfway up the hill suggesting water pipe leaking
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Corndean Lane, Winchcombe
